publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-785 Roseanna Cunningham: Celtic Connections-That the Parliament welcomes the return of the "Celtic Connections" music festival to Glasgow; notes that "Celtic Connections" has become one of the world's great Celtic festivals with more than 200 events at 10 venues across Glasgow this year; welcomes the combination of famous names, inspired collaborations and the cream of new talent from Scotland and abroad; hopes that this year's festival can top the record 100,000 ticket sales achieved last year which generated more than £3 million for the city of Glasgow, and further hopes that there will be many more successful years for "Celtic Connections".

S2M-785 Celtic Connections (lodged on 14 January 2004) Stewart Stevenson*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Ms Sandra White*, Jim Mather*, Bruce Crawford*, Brian Adam*, Richard Lochhead*, Campbell Martin*, Michael Matheson*, Tommy Sheridan*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Linda Fabiani*, Scott Barrie*, Mr Bruce McFee*

S2M-785 Roseanna Cunningham: Celtic Connections-That the Parliament welcomes the return of the "Celtic Connections" music festival to Glasgow; notes that "Celtic Connections" has become one of the world's great Celtic festivals with more than 200 events at 10 venues across Glasgow this year; welcomes the combination of famous names, inspired collaborations and the cream of new talent from Scotland and abroad; hopes that this year's festival can top the record 100,000 ticket sales achieved last year which generated more than £3 million for the city of Glasgow, and further hopes that there will be many more successful years for "Celtic Connections". Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Rob Gibson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Ms Sandra White, Jim Mather, Bruce Crawford, Brian Adam, Richard Lochhead, Campbell Martin, Michael Matheson, Tommy Sheridan, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Linda Fabiani, Scott Barrie, Mr Bruce McFee, Colin Fox*
S2M-785 Celtic Connections (lodged on 14 January 2004) Donald Gorrie*

*S2M-785 Roseanna Cunningham: Celtic Connections-That the Parliament welcomes the return of the "Celtic Connections" music festival to Glasgow; notes that "Celtic Connections" has become one of the world's great Celtic festivals with more than 200 events at 10 venues across Glasgow this year; welcomes the combination of famous names, inspired collaborations and the cream of new talent from Scotland and abroad; hopes that this year's festival can top the record 100,000 ticket sales achieved last year which generated more than £3 million for the city of Glasgow, and further hopes that there will be many more successful years for "Celtic Connections". *The member has provided the following Gaelic translation: Gu bheil a' Phàrlamaid a' cur fàilte air tilleadh fèis ciùil Ghlaschu "Celtic Connections"; gu bheil i a' toirt fainear gu bheil "Celtic Connections" air fàs gu bhith mar tè de phrìomh fhèisean Ceilteach an t-saoghail le còrr is 200 tachartas aig deich àiteachan air feadh Ghlaschu am bliadhna; gu bheil i a' cur fàilte air a' mheasgachadh de dh' ainmean ainmeil, de cho-oibreachadh lèirsinneach agus den tàlant ùr as fheàrr à Alba agus à thall thairis; gu bheil i an dòchas gun urrainn do dh' fhèis na bliadhna seo barrachd thiocaidean a reic na na 100,000 a chaidh a reic an-uiridh agus a thog còrr is £3 millean airson Cathair Ghlaschu; agus gu bheil i cuideachd an dòchas gum bi iomadh bliadhna shoirbheachail eile aig "Celtic Connections".*
S2M-785 Celtic Connections (lodged on 14 January 2004) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-785 Celtic Connections (lodged on 14 January 2004) Rosie Kane*
S2M-785 Celtic Connections (lodged on 14 January 2004) Christine Grahame*
S2M-785 Celtic Connections (lodged on 14 January 2004) Pauline McNeill*
